Articles.Content: [Lokaltog's](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/151071-Lokaltog) KeRD mod is a remote display for Kerbal Space Program that runs as a browser app. The mod takes its data from the Telemachus plugin and features a live map view with markers, biome maps, a high contrast navball and a lot of data about your current flight. A great way to get KSP data onto a second monitor! More information is available in the [**forum thread**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/127667)**\*** \*Requires the mod [Telemachus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24594-1-0-4-%282015-07-04%29-Telemachus-%E2%80%93-Telemetry-and-Flight-Control-in-the-Web-Browser?p=302775&viewfull=1#post302775) to be installed. **Edited July 8, 2015 by sjwt** Added link to Telemachus

if this is what i think it is, then WOW

-jaddbo
Yes... Yes... more of this please! Ridiculous for me to even think about thinking that things like this should be in the stock program. Yet, still...

Impressive.

...that neither in this post nor in the first post of the linked to mod there is no link to this "Telemachus" plugin. I guess I (and everybody) will just Google it.

I have neither a second monitor nor room in which to place it... ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

...but if I did, I'd love to get this mod! Mainly so me and my friend can play a multiplayer version, in which I misinterpret his commands, muck up my flight angle and smack into a particularly tall mountain on Pol.

> 
> Impressive.
> ...that neither in this post nor in the first post of the linked to mod there is no link to this "Telemachus" plugin. I guess I (and everybody) will just Google it.

It is listed in the install instructions for the mod but not directly linked to the download, so thanks for the reminder, I've added a link to the OP for the main forum post for it

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-08T05:56:03Z" title="07/08/2015 05:56  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 8, 2015</time> by sjwt**

Wow, fancy stuff!

Also, good to have KSP on a second monitor, this way I can have my eyes on the craft and the orbit at the same time. Cool!
I have used this with buddies as one of several mods to create a full mock mission control and I will attest that it is friggin awesome when used like that.

> 
> I have used this with buddies as one of several mods to create a full mock mission control and I will attest that it is friggin awesome when used like that.

How was the data link stability? KeRD should be much more stable than the stock Telemachus interface.
